text: Douglas James Kershaw (born January 24, 1936) is an American fiddle player, record producer and singer-songwriter. He was born in Cameron Parish, Louisiana. He began his career as part of the duo Rusty and Doug, along with his brother, Rusty Kershaw. He also had a solo career that included fifteen albums and singles that charted on the Hot Country Songs charts. In 2009, he became a member of the Louisiana Music Hall of Fame. ==References== Category:1936 births Category:Living people Category:American singer- songwriters Category:American guitarists Category:Country musicians from Louisiana Category:American folk musicians Category:American country singers Category:American folk singers Category:American record producers Category:Singers from Louisiana Category:Businesspeople from Louisiana
title: Doug Kershaw
